intro: Tromotriche pedunculata subsp. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed tromotriche, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tromotriche pedunculata subsp. longipes is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
